text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with King Ranch chicken casserole
this casserole was invented by boxing
promoter Don King who has a ranch in
Texas I can't be about research the
accuracy of that but that's right here
alright so let's get started you're
going to need some corn tortillas I'm
using fancy designer San Francisco kind
but any will do some cooked chicken meat
this could be leftovers this could be
what I used a rotisserie chicken some
cheddar cheese some green pepper or some
red pepper and on to some white onion
alright most recipes for King Ranch
casserole call for the onions and the
peppers raw but I'm going to give them a
quick saute literally two minutes in a
hot pan with just a tablespoon of oil
just to take the edge off okay I'm not
going to really cook them I'm just gonna
kind of warm them through
so those sauteed on high heat for just
two minutes all right I'm going to dump
those in a bowl I'm gonna add some
chicken stock and then it gets crazy
cream of mushroom soup cream of chicken
soup oh yeah and one word of advice you
probably don't want to read the labels
on those condensed soups not a good idea
anyway some sour cream a can of diced
tomatoes to have the chilies in it you
know the Rotel little pinch of oregano
some cumin some ancho chili powder some
chipotle chili powder of course all the
ingredients will be on food which is
calm so check out the amounts alright
we're going to give that a stir and you
know if it looks that good now just
imagine how good it's going to look when
it's cooked that looks terrible I'm
gonna switch to a whisk that looks
better
all right the tortillas we're going to
take and we're going to cut in quarters
and then I'm going to start building
this thing now I'm going to put a little
bit of sauce down on the bottom and
here's where I made a mistake I should
have done it how I usually do it but I
tried to get an extra layer of tortilla
so I put a layer of tortilla at the
bottom don't do that just start with
half the chicken do not repeat do not
put the first layer of tortilla at the
bottom so little sauce half the chicken
and then the rest as you see okay then
it's almost half the sauce not quite
half the sauce all right we're going to
put down one third of the cheese
a layer of tortilla and you don't really
need them to overlap you just have to
basically cover the layer so I like to
put the corners in the corners and the
rest you can kind of piece together then
the other half of the chicken then
almost the rest of the sauce and why I
say almost save about a half a cup of
sauce for the top spread that out we're
going to sprinkle over the next third of
the cheese we're going to put our last
layer of tortilla so in this video you
see three layers of tortilla one on the
bottom then one a little one on top I'm
going to advise you not to do the one at
the bottom and now I will stop talking
about that okay the rest of the sauce
that 1/2 cup you saved goes on the top
just spread it around you want to make
sure all the tortilla has a little bit
of sauce on it so it doesn't get crispy
and burnt alright the last third of
cheese all right we're going to put that
in a 350 degree oven for 40 minutes or
until bubbly now it may or may not be
browned on top what I do is cheat I fire
up the broiler for a couple minutes to
brown the top I think it looks really
cool and that's it King Ranch chicken
casserole basically a chicken enchilada
pie very delicious by the way feel free
to spice this up this is actually pretty
mild if you want to put some jalapeno in
there or some Cayenne feel free I think
it'd be a great idea and that's it King
Ranch chicken casserole a beautiful
hearty dish your family will love go to
the site get all the ingredients and as
always enjoy
